definition: mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve
to close/to stop up/to shut/to obstruct

sentences.english: When finished with the list, click OK then close out of Local Group Policy Editor.
sentences.chinese: 完成列表后，点击确定并关闭本地组策略编辑器。

sentences.english: The toner cartridge engages when the door is closed.
sentences.chinese: 盖门关闭后，硒鼓将锁定就位。

sentences.english: The sprinklers will remain off when it rains.
sentences.chinese: 下雨的时候，洒水器会自动关闭。

sentences.english: And Rinpoche has vowed to turn off the water while brushing his teeth.
sentences.chinese: 仁波切本身则誓言在刷牙时要关闭水龙头。

sentences.english: The bladder is thin-walled and closed by a one-way valve.
sentences.chinese: 浮囊具有薄壁的结构并且通过单方向的阀门关闭。

sentences.english: Now we have a vending machine that we can turn on and off.
sentences.chinese: 现在我们有了一台可以开启和关闭的自动售货机。

sentences.english: Keep valves closed when cylinders are not in service or empty.
sentences.chinese: 当钢瓶没有使用或是空瓶的时候，保持阀门关闭。

sentences.english: Close public restaurants, lounges and shops.
sentences.chinese: 关闭公共餐厅，酒廊和商店。

sentences.english: Flooding forced the closure of manufacturing plants in Ayutthaya, according to news reports.
sentences.chinese: 据新闻报道，洪水已迫使大城府的制造工厂关闭。

sentences.english: BGM or turn it or any other sounds of the game off.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想改变BGM或关闭游戏中的声音就走过去。
关闭闸门将是非常困难的。

sentences.english: Added an option to turn off smoke and dust off the tank tracks.
sentences.chinese: 增加了可以关闭坦克行驶时的烟雾和扬尘的选项。

sentences.english: Unlike ROM, RAM chips lose their data once power is shut off.
sentences.chinese: 不像罗，一旦失去他们的数据片公权力关闭。

sentences.english: All needle valves must be closed on test kit.
sentences.chinese: 检测组件上的所有针形阀都必须关闭。
关闭非重要的空气进口。

sentences.english: The chain reaction that actually runs the reactor can be shut off in a matter of seconds.
sentences.chinese: 实际运行反应堆的链式反应可以在数秒左右被关闭。

definition: to close a door/to lock a door/(of a shop etc) to close (for the night, or permanently)
(of a power plant, refinery etc) to shut down
to seal/to close/to confine/to seal off/to close down/sealed/confined/closed/unreceptive
to withdraw/to abort/to quit/to log out (computing)
to start (a machine)/(fig.) to set in motion/to launch (an operation)/to activate (a plan)
to screen/to block (sth or sb)/to shield/(protective) shield
to cut short/to break off/to discontinue/to interrupt
